content:
i just tried to create a profil using Trifolia on FHIR: https://trifolia-fhir.lantanagroup.com
If i click save nothings happens, only this error is shown: *Error loading structure definitions.: Http failure response for https://trifolia-fhir.lantanagroup.com/api/structureDefinition?page=1&name=task&: 502 OK *
Is the hosted Trifolia on FHIR currently broken?
@Rick Geimer @Sean McIlvenna
I'll look into this as soon as I can
should be within the next hour or two
There's definitely something weird going on with the server...
Ok, @Patrick Werner , I believe it is working now
Can you please check?
For some reason, the HAPI server needed to be restarted via Tomcat
it is! Thanks a lot.
If anyone else has any issues please let me and Sean know. We did an upgrade of the HAPI server, and noticed a few issues after that Sean is looking into this morning.
Sean deployed a fix, the issues (mainly page content intermittently dissappearing) is fixed.

before login in i get this error on the page:
Error loading structure definitions.: Http failure response for https://trifolia-fhir.lantanagroup.com/api/structureDefinition?page=1&: 401 OK

I think you should start by logging in here:
https://trifolia-fhir.lantanagroup.com

Then use the menus to navigate.
And maybe quit your browser to log out completely first, as I believe @Sean McIlvenna 's fix may have involved new JavaScript, etc.

found another issue:
In Additional->Context: removing a textbox with the trashbin icon is not possible, also i can't find context.type which is an important element and therefore 1..1
@Patrick Werner I'll take a look at this...
@Patrick Werner , I just updated ToF to fix this issue.
(the issue with Profiles > Additional > Context in R4)
I am getting a "Trifolia Workbench is offline" from Trifolia - is this a known outage?
@Sean McIlvenna

@Vivian Neilley , sorry to hear about this!
FYI, "Trifolia Workbench is offline" comes from the "Trifolia Workbench" product, which is not the same as #trifolia-on-fhir
With that said, at first glance, it appears to be online right now. Can you confirm that you are still receiving this error? Also, can you confirm what steps you are taking to receive this error (if you still are getting the error)?

Good to know, thank you @Sean McIlvenna - I was logging in via my Git account and am getting the same error right at login. "If this is an issue you feel you need to report to an administrator, please take note of the time (shown below).
11/30/2021, 9:02:42 AM". Still am getting it (hence timestamp)

Thanks for the info @Vivian Neilley. I'll get someone to check this out and see what's wrong. In the meantime, you could try other login methods (Microsoft, Google, or user/pass, for example). I use the user/pass method, myself, and it seems to be working.
@Vivian Neilley , please try Github auth again
@Michael Misiaszek restarted TWB and indicated that it's working for him at the moment
fixed, thank you so much @Sean McIlvenna !!
You're welcome!
